page.title: 01THE VILLAGE OF GRETTON
page.content: The village of Gretton is situated on a hill overlooking the beautiful Welland Valley. Old stone houses line the main street, giving way to council houses and a private estate on the outer perimeter. Four shops serve the people - a Post Office cum general store, a newsagent's, a Co-operative store and a hairdresser's. St. James's Church is the oldest building in the village. There is a village hall which is the meeting place of many social groups, also of a playgroup for children under school age. Gretton Primary School provides a good education for children up to 11 years old. There are three public houses where the local people can meet for a drink and to play bar games. A craft workshop offers tuition in spinning and weaving, whilst a local factory employs several village people.
